channel.title: Misc :: Digital Dilemma
channel.description: Things that don’t fit elsewhere. Redneck PC Water Cooling Unreal Tournament Using Gpslogger With Traccar

item.title: Redneck PC Water Cooling
item.description: Cooling servers using household plumbing “How to water cool computers using household plumbing equipment” I like peace and quiet. Most water cooling rigs available for home PCs are anything but – they only use water to move the heat away from the CPU and GPU to a finned radiator, then blast it with fans. I thought that radiant cooling would work and not need any fans, so I built a water cooling system. It worked perfectly for a linux server and my gaming windows PC for three years, until I had to free up space and instead focussed on sound proofing a cupboard and using air cooling. This was back in 2010 but there’s no reason why it wouldn’t work today.

item.title: Unreal Tournament
item.description: Unreal Tournament (Very) old things relating to Unreal Tournament; Probably the best FPS ever made. Aimbot Faq Domination Ut Bible

item.title: Using Gpslogger With Traccar
item.description: Making two excellent pieces of free software talk to each other Traccar is an amazing piece of free, open source software to track GPS devices and people. GPSLogger is an amazing piece of free software that records GPS tracks on Android very well. Wouldn’t it be nice if you could use GPSLogger to send your position to Traccar? Well, you can, and it’s not hard. Why not just use Traccar’s Android client? A good question, and there’s no reason why not. It (usually) works fine. however, I did have a few issues with it that, whilsts not serious, were enough to steer me towards GPSlogger.
